15-7-1-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
15-7-1-1.indicator_name: Proportion of species of wild animals that are object to poaching or illegal trafficking from the total number of species of the corresponding systematic groups (classes)
15-7-1-1.graph_title: Proportion of species of wild animals that are object to poaching or illegal trafficking from the total number of species of the corresponding systematic groups (classes)
15-7-1-1.goal_name: 15. Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
15-7-1-1.target_name: 15.7 Take urgent action to end poaching and trafficking of protected species of flora and fauna and address both demand and supply of illegal wildlife products
15-7-1-1.indicator_name1: 15.7.1.1 Proportion of species of wild animals that are object to poaching or illegal trafficking from the total number of species of the corresponding systematic groups (classes)
15-7-1-1.organization_name: State Agency for Environmental Protection and Forestry under the Government of the KRU, Department of Conservation of Protected Areas
15-7-1-1.contact_name: Turdumatov Talantbek Kubanychbekovich, Musaev Almaz Mustafaevich
15-7-1-1.definitions:
Prevention of poaching and smuggling of protected species of fauna.
Identification and suppression of poaching and illegal trafficking of wildlife. 
Determines the percentage of animal species regulated by the CITES Convention that have become objects of poaching or illicit trafficking to the total number of species of the corresponding classes living in the republic.
15-7-1-1.concepts:
Poaching – facts of violations of environmental management/ all types of illegal hunting, and the production of hunting using prohibited fishing gear.
The CITES Convention is a convention on International trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora, signed on March 3, 1973 in Washington.
15-7-1-1.rationale_interpretation: The indicator is formed on the basis of data obtained from materials on the identification of poaching with damage to certain species of wild animals, the trade of which is regulated by the CITES Convention.
15-7-1-1.data_sources: Information from departmental reports of authorized government agencies responsible for identifying and suppressing poaching, bringing violators (poachers) to justice, and monitoring the implementation of the CITES Convention.
15-7-1-1.data_collection: The method of data collection is the interdepartmental exchange of relevant information at the request of interested parties.
15-7-1-1.computation_methods: Sampling of data from available sources.
15-7-1-1.comments_limitations: The completeness of the information received depends on the careful and regular implementation of security measures, improving the interdepartmental interaction of special authorized bodies, whose activities are related to the regulation of the use and trade of wildlife.
15-7-1-1.quality_assurance: The competence of authorized persons in the reliable determination of the species/subspecies composition of animals subjected to illegal extraction or trade.
15-7-1-1.data_availability_gaps: The data is available to interested parties on the websites of specialized bodies, in relevant country reports on biodiversity conservation and compliance with the CITES Convention.
15-7-1-1.international_comparability: It is a national indicator corresponding to the global indicator 15.7.1. The proportion of wild animals that are the object of poaching or illegal trafficking for species that are traded.
15-7-1-1.references_documentation: The indicator is formed according to the UNECE Guidelines "Environmental Indicators and Assessment Reports based on them", and the methodology of the SDG indicators, based on available data and consultations.

3-1-2.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
3-1-2.indicator_name: Proportion of births attended by skilled health personnel
3-1-2.graph_title: Доля родов, принятых квалифицированными медицинскими работниками
3-1-2.goal_name: 3: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-1-2.target_name: 3.1: By 2030, reduce the global maternal mortality ratio to less than 70 per 100,000 live births
3-1-2.indicator_name1: 3.1.2 Proportion of births attended by skilled health personnel
3-1-2.organization_name: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Social Statistics Division)
3-1-2.definitions: Percentage of births attended by skilled health personnel is the percentage of deliveries attended by health personnel trained in providing lifesaving obstetric care, including giving the necessary supervision, care and advice to women during pregnancy, labour and the post-partum period, conducting deliveries on their own, and caring for newborns.
3-1-2.concepts:
WHO defines childbirth is a normal physiological process that can occur without complications for most women and children born. Skilled health personnel are only those trained and have equipment and medicines at their disposal. Traditional birth attendants, even if they receive a short training course, are not included.
Skilled childbirth assistance is provided by doctors, nurses or midwifes.
3-1-2.rationale_interpretation:
Analyzing this indicator along with other indicators, makes it possible to assess effectiveness of preventive measures, work of local health authorities to protect mothers and children and to develop a number of specific measures to improve health of women during pregnancies and children.
Having a skilled attendant at the time of delivery is an important lifesaving intervention for both mothers and babies. Not having access to this key assistance is detrimental to women's health and gender empowerment because it could cause the death of the mother or long lasting disability, especially in marginalized (distanced) settings.
3-1-2.data_sources: Data for this indicator are obtained from administrative data of the Ministry of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic. A State reporting Form No. 14 "Report on hospital activities", is produced on an annual basis.
3-1-2.data_collection: Regional health centers collect statistical reports in accordance with the form Form No. 14 "Report on hospital activities". Observation method used is continuous observation. Observation units – each delivery.
3-1-2.computation_methods: The indicator is calculated as the number of deliveries (including deliveries in 22-27 weeks) minus the number of deliveries of women who gave birth outside health facilities to the total number of deliveries in health facilities, multiplied by 100%.
3-1-2.comments_limitations: Direct measurement requires high-quality surveillance systems in which underreporting is negligible and strong health systems so that under-diagnosis is also negligible; otherwise indirect estimates are based on notification data and estimates of levels of underreporting and under-diagnosis.
3-1-2.data_availability_gaps: Data has been available since 2007 onwards.
3-1-2.disaggregation: Indicator is calculated nationally and by regions (Republic, regions, city of Bishkek, city of Osh).
3-1-2.references_documentation:
www.uis.unesco.org , 
KR National SDG Reporting Platform: https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan.github.io

15-a-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
15-a-1.indicator_name: (a) Official development assistance on conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity; and (b) revenue generated and finance mobilized from biodiversity-relevant economic instruments
15-a-1.graph_title: (a) Official development assistance on conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity; and (b) revenue generated and finance mobilized from biodiversity-relevant economic instruments
15-a-1.goal_name: 15 Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss.
15-a-1.target_name: 15.a Mobilize and significantly increase financial resources from all sources to conserve and sustainably use biodiversity and ecosystems
15-a-1.indicator_name1: 15.a.1 (a) Official development assistance on conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity; and (b) revenue generated and finance mobilized from biodiversity-relevant economic instruments
15-a-1.organization_name: Ministry of Finance of the Kyrgyz Republic
15-a-1.contact_name: Chinara Sharshenovna Kenjebaeva – Head of International Cooperation Department a.i, Ministry of Finance of the Kyrgyz Republic
15-a-1.definitions: Official development assistance and public expenditure on conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity and ecosystems is defined as Gross disbursements of total ODA from all donors for biodiversity.
15-a-1.concepts: ODA: The DAC defines ODA as “those flows to countries and territories on the DAC List of ODA Recipients and to multilateral institutions which are i) provided by official agencies, including state and local governments, or by their executive agencies; and ii) each transaction is administered with the promotion of the economic development and welfare of developing countries as its main objective; and is concessional in character and conveys a grant element of at least 25 per cent.
15-a-1.rationale_interpretation: Total ODA flows to developing countries quantify the public effort that donors provide to developing countries for biodiversity.
15-a-1.data_collection: Reporting on funds allocated on public investment projects implementation (monthly), reporting on public investment projects’ progress (quarterly)
15-a-1.computation_methods: The sum of ODA flows from all donors to developing countries that have biodiversity as a principal or significant objective.
15-a-1.quality_assurance: Statistics are submitted to all donors during the calendar year and may differ from fiscal year data available in budget documents for some countries.
15-a-1.data_availability_gaps: On a recipient basis for all developing countries eligible for ODA. Statistics are submitted on an annual basis.
15-a-1.disaggregation: This indicator can be disaggregated by donor, recipient country, type of finance, type of aid, sector, etc.
15-a-1.references_documentation:
The Kyrgyz Republic SDG National Reporting Platform: https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan.github.io
http://www/amp.gov.kg http://www.oecd.org/dac/stats/methodology.htm

15-5-1-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
15-5-1-1.indicator_name: Proportion of red-listed species from all species of the corresponding systematic groups (classes)
15-5-1-1.graph_title: Proportion of red-listed species from all species of the corresponding systematic groups (classes)
15-5-1-1.goal_name: 15. Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
15-5-1-1.target_name: 15.5 Take urgent and significant action to reduce the degradation of natural habitats, halt the loss of biodiversity and, by 2020, protect and prevent the extinction of threatened species
15-5-1-1.indicator_name1: 15.5.1.1 Proportion of red-listed species from all species of the corresponding systematic groups (classes)
15-5-1-1.organization_name: State Agency for Environmental Protection and Forestry under the Government of the KRU, Department of Conservation of Protected Areas
15-5-1-1.contact_name: Turdumatov Talantbek Kubanychbekovich, Musaev Almaz Mustafaevich
15-5-1-1.definitions: Defines the list of species listed in the Red Book The Kyrgyz Republic, the management of which is one of the forms of conservation of biological diversity, containing information on the most vulnerable species of animals and plants and practical recommendations for the stabilization or restoration of their numbers.
15-5-1-1.concepts: Rare, endangered or endangered species/subspecies of animals, plants and fungi are those that are threatened with extinction, the number of individuals encountered is insufficient to restore and self-preserve the population in natural conditions.
15-5-1-1.rationale_interpretation:
The basis for compiling (availability of) lists of species/subspecies of animals, plants and fungi is the established need to take urgent measures for their protection and reproduction. 
The indicator makes it possible to assess the state of biodiversity in terms of the number of endangered species and the relative effectiveness of responses taken at the national level, i.e. actions taken to preserve national and global biodiversity. Biological diversity is a prerequisite for the sustainable functioning of ecosystems.
The indicator characterizes the state of populations of representatives of fauna and flora belonging to species groups that are of crucial resource importance and play an important role in terms of biodiversity conservation. It also helps to reflect the balance of economic interests with the interests of biodiversity conservation.
15-5-1-1.data_sources: The data is generated based on the lists of species/subspecies of animals, plants and fungi to be included in the Red Book of the Kyrgyz Republic, approved by the decree of the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic.
15-5-1-1.data_collection:
"The indicator is formed on the basis of the list of species in the Red Book of the Kyrgyz Republic, approved by Resolution of the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic dated April 28, 2005 No. 170 "On Approval of lists of rare and endangered species of animals and plants for inclusion in the Red Book of the Kyrgyz Republic" (vredaktion PP KR dated July 25, 2009 No. 471).
In all sections of the Red Book of the Kyrgyz Republic (2007), the 2004 IUCN category system was used (with necessary modifications).
Since 1963, the IUCN has maintained an international list of threatened animal and plant species (Red Book).
The National Academy of Sciences of the Kyrgyz Republic also carries out accounting for certain types.
"
15-5-1-1.computation_methods:
The proportion of endangered species in the total number of Red Book species
The method of calculating this form of representation of the indicator:
Proportion of species (%) = Total number of endangered species / Total number of Red Book species * 100
15-5-1-1.comments_limitations: The presence of financial constraints and a lack of specialists, leading to a possible listing in the Red Book In case of insufficient or unreliable information about their condition, as well as current changes in their condition, the identification of species/subspecies of animals, plants and fungi requires periodic review of the condition of species/subspecies of animals, plants and fungi in order to identify those in need of special protection measures.
15-5-1-1.quality_assurance: Making decisions on species/subspecies in need of special protection measures and compiling lists of them for listing in the Red Book The assessment should be based on a full assessment of their condition and the dynamics of changes.
15-5-1-1.data_availability_gaps: The availability of data for interested parties is ensured by the adopted Government decree No. 170 of the Kyrgyz Republic dated April 28, 2005 "On Approval of Lists of Rare and Endangered Species of Animals and Plants for Inclusion in the Red Book of the Kyrgyz Republic (as amended by Government Decree KR dated July 25, 2009, No. 471), the printed edition of the Red Book of the Kyrgyz Republic.
15-5-1-1.international_comparability: It is a national indicator corresponding to global indicator 15.5.1.1. Red List Index.
15-5-1-1.references_documentation: The indicator is formed according to the UNECE Guidelines "Environmental Indicators and Assessment Reports based on them", and the methodology of the SDG indicators, based on available data and consultations.

8-10-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
8-10-1.indicator_name: (a) Number of commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults and (b) number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults
8-10-1.graph_title: (a) Number of commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults and (b) number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults
8-10-1.goal_name: 8. Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all.
8-10-1.target_name: 8.10. Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all.
8-10-1.indicator_name1: 8.10.1: Number of (a) commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults (b) number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults
8-10-1.contact_email:
NBKR: jsulaimanbekova@nbkr.kg and elelevkina@nbkr.kg;
NSC KR: Jmaatkulova@stat.kg
8-10-1.definitions:
The number of commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults
The number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults
8-10-1.concepts:
A bank branch is a semi-independent bank unit located outside the bank’s main location, which is not a legal entity, carrying out all or part of the banking operations on behalf of the bank, pursuant to the Regulation on a branch approved by the bank, and operating within the limits of its powers, provided by the bank.
ATM - an automated teller machine for issuing and/or accepting cash, recording cash on a card, receiving information on completed transactions by a cardholder, making non-cash payments and issuing cards/receipt for all types of transactions.  ATM is bank equipment and is intended for independent user transactions without participation of authorized employee of commercial bank.
Adults – country’s average annual population aged 16 and older (people can open a bank account and have a card from the age of 16).
8-10-1.rationale_interpretation: Describes access to and use of formal financial services. Services such as savings, insurance, payments, credit and remittances allow people to manage their lives, plan and pay expenses, grow their businesses and improve their overall welfare. As banks remain one of the key institutions for access to formal financial services, having an accessible bank branch is an important initial point of access to financial services and therefore use of them. Bank branches are complemented by other important points of access such as automated teller machines of all formal financial institutions, which can extend financial services to remote locations.
8-10-1.data_sources: Data on branches of commercial banks (source - Register of Commercial Banks Branches) and ATMs (source - Commercial Banks' Periodic Regulatory Bank Reports) are submitted to NBKR; Average annual population - data obtained from the NSC KR Demographic Statistics Division.
8-10-1.data_collection:
Branches of commercial banks open by decisions of bank authorized management body, in accordance with the charter. The National Bank of the Kyrgyz Republic issues the consent/registration to structural subdivisions of commercial banks based on applications of commercial banks in accordance with the Regulation on Licensing of Activities of Banks dated June 8, 2017-P-12/23/1-(RLA).
Records on commercial banks branches are kept in the NBKR Register. Data are used on an annual basis. Data on ATMs are compiled monthly based on information provided by commercial banks at the beginning of the month. Data on the number of ATMs is provided by commercial banks monthly until 20th of each month following the reporting period. ATM data are provided in Section 20 of PRBR, subsection 20 B. Commercial banks report only on operating ATMs.
8-10-1.comments_limitations: Data have been submitted to NBKR since 2003 within the framework of NBKR Annual Report and quarterly reports since 2014 (by regions and Bishkek). Reports are available on NBKR website.
8-10-1.quality_assurance:
Data provided by commercial banks in accordance with the Regulation on the Periodic Regulatory Bank Report, approved by Decree of the Board of the National Bank of the Kyrgyz Republic on 25 August 2005, № 26/5.
Opening/closing of commercial banks branches is regulated by the Regulation on Licensing of Banks dated 8 June № 2017 2017 - П -12/23/1-(RLA)
8-10-1.data_availability_gaps: Updates on the number of commercial banks are published in the section "Bank Functions/Banking System" of the official NBKR website by regions and city of Bishkek. On a monthly basis - in Table IV.3.1 "Information on Head Offices and Branches of Commercial Banks" "NBKR Bulletin", in "Publications" section of the official NBKR website. Quarterly data on the number of installed ATMs in regions and Bishkek can be found in the section "Bank Functions/Payment System/Overview of Trends in the KR Payment System" of the NBKR official website; annually in the NBKR Annual Report section "Publications/Annual Report" of the NBKR official website.
8-10-1.disaggregation: Data on the indicator are provided for the Kyrgyz Republic as a whole.
8-10-1.international_comparability:
Data collected annually for 189 countries, including Kyrgyz Republic by FAS group (FINANCIAL ACCESS SURVEY) from administrative data sources. Data published on the FAS site - http:///data.imf.org/fas. However, this source uses its approach to adult population.
NBKR reports annually on the number of branches of commercial banks and ATMs to IMF by completing FAS survey.
8-10-1.references_documentation:
KR National SDG Reporting Platform: https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan.github.io
Metadata on the UN website https://unstats.un.org/sdgs/metadata/
Data on the number of branches of commercial banks can be found: 
1. https://www.nbkr.kg/index1.jsp?item=69&lang=RUS
2. https://www.nbkr.kg/index1.jsp?item=137&lang=RUS
Data on the number of installed ATMs at the end of the reporting period can be found: 
1. https://www.nbkr.kg/index1.jsp?item=98&lang=RUS; 
2. https://www.nbkr.kg/index1.jsp?item=136&lang=RUS

15-3-1-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
15-3-1-1.indicator_name: Arable land area for reasons of non-use
15-3-1-1.graph_title: Arable land area for reasons of non-use
15-3-1-1.measurement_units: At the beginning of the year, thousand hectares
15-3-1-1.goal_name: 15. Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
15-3-1-1.target_name: 15.3 By 2030, combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land degradation-neutral world
15-3-1-1.indicator_name1: 15.3.1.1 Arable land area for reasons of non-use
15-3-1-1.organization_name: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Department of Agricultural Statistics)
15-3-1-1.definitions: Arable land is agricultural land that is annually cultivated and used for sowing crops, perennial grasses, as well as crops between rows of perennial plantings, plus pairs and the area of household plots. Agricultural crop acreage is the area occupied by crops by the end of sowing of spring crops. An unused arable land is an area where no work is carried out on the arable land for cultivating crops and cultivating the soil.
15-3-1-1.concepts: Agricultural lands are of particular importance as a means of producing agricultural products.The involvement of unused arable agricultural land in agricultural turnover is an important strategic task for all participants in agricultural production.  Unused arable land is formed at the aiyl okmotu level, which allows you to determine unused arable land and the reasons for not using it. Taken in dynamics, the data of unused arable land reveal a trend of change in the structure of agricultural crops.
15-3-1-1.rationale_interpretation: The purpose of developing the unused arable land indicator is to provide the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic with the necessary and reliable information on the size of agricultural crops and on the use of arable land.
15-3-1-1.data_sources: The sources of information for calculating the unused arable land indicator are: form No. 4-CX "Report on the results of sowing for the harvest of 202_g." Section 2. Land area as of 1.01.202__ Line 210 unused arable land total, including for reasons (p. 211 to p. 226).
15-3-1-1.data_collection: The sources of information for calculating the unused arable land indicator are: form No. 4-CX "Report on the results of sowing for the harvest of 202_g." Section 2. Land area as of 1.01.202__ Line 210 unused arable land total, including for reasons (p. 211 to p. 226).
15-3-1-1.computation_methods: Line 210 "Unused arable land" - the area of unused arable land is taken into account. It is calculated by subtracting from the area of arable land (line 202) the acreage on arable land (line 174), the area of steam (line 207), the area of protected soil (line 208), the arable land used for nurseries, perennial plantings and flowers (line 209). that is, page 210 = page 202-174-207-208-209.  Then the reasons for not using the arable land are shown (Line 211 on page 226)
15-3-1-1.comments_limitations: Unused area is calculated according to the following scheme: the basis for determining unused arable land is a report on acreage and Line 210 "Unused arable land" is calculated - the area of unused arable land is taken into account. It is calculated by subtracting from the area of arable land (line 202) the acreage on arable land (line 174), the area of steam (line 207), the area of protected soil (line 208), the arable land used for nurseries, perennial plantings and flowers (line 209). .  Then the reasons for not using the arable land are shown.:  P. 211 in connection with salinization and waterlogging, p. 212 due to lack of seed material, p. 213 due to the lack of irrigation network, lack of irrigation, p. 214 due to the harsh weather (lack of moisture in the soil in spring), p. 215 due to remoteness, rockiness, p. 216 due to lack of fuel and equipment, p. 217 due to lack of funds, p. 218 due to exposure to natural disasters, p. 219 due to employment under buildings, p. 220 due to allotment for a cemetery, p. 221 due to capital planning, reclamation construction, p. 222 in connection with the allotment for industry, p. 223 in connection with the expansion of settlements, p. 224 in connection with the fact that houses are empty, p. 225 in connection with the unwillingness or inability to cultivate the household plot and p. 226 in connection with the self-seizure of land. The sum of lines 211 through 226 should be taken into account, which should equal line 210.
15-3-1-1.quality_assurance:
After the development of the unused area indicator, logical and
arithmetic control is carried out on the acreage of agricultural crops..
15-3-1-1.data_availability_gaps: Publication in the yearbook Agriculture of the Kyrgyz Republic, a collection of the final report on the size of sown areas of crops for the harvest of 202__ year.
15-3-1-1.disaggregation: The indicators are calculated by territory
15-3-1-1.international_comparability: The methodology was agreed with the FAO Representative Office in the Kyrgyz Republic.
15-3-1-1.references_documentation:
"Methodology for the formation and calculation of unused arable land (resolution of the National Statistical Committee of ______.2020 №____)
The National SDG Reporting Platform of the Kyrgyz Republic: https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan .github.io

10-5-1-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
10-5-1-1.goal_name: 10. Reduce inequality within and among countries
10-5-1-1.target_name: 10.5 Improve the regulation and monitoring of global financial markets and institutions and strengthen the implementation of such regulations
10-5-1-1.organization_name: National Bank of the Kyrgyz Republic (Department of Systemic Risk Analysis)
10-5-1-1.concepts:
Assets of the banking system Deposit base of the banking system
Loan portfolio of the banking system of GDP
10-5-1-1.rationale_interpretation:
"To ensure an increase in indicators reflecting the availability of banking services, an increase in the level of financial intermediation of the banking system.According to the Main directions of development of the banking sector for 2018-2021. In the medium term, the National Bank will continue to implement measures aimed at sustainable development and increasing the role of the banking and non-banking sectors in the economy of the Kyrgyz Republic, focused on maintaining the efficiency, security and reliability of their activities, creating conditions for improving regional and affordability of banking, payment and microfinance services, reducing weighted average interest rates on loans, and There is also a further expansion of the provision of services based on Islamic principles of financing.                                                              In the medium term, based on the indicators of previous periods, the National Bank plans to increase indicators reflecting the availability of banking services and increase the level of financial intermediation in the banking system.
The National Bank has an indirect impact on the growth of the level of financial intermediation through the improvement of the regulatory framework and the creation of equal conditions for their participants, further growth in the level of financial intermediation directly depends on the intentions of shareholders of commercial banks and their chosen policy to increase the capital base, and measures to further increase assets.       It is planned to ensure an increase in the level of financial intermediation of the banking system, including through the introduction of innovative technologies in banking, the development of the lending market, the introduction of remote service elements, and further measures to implement mechanisms that facilitate commercial banks' operations with depersonalized metal accounts. In addition, measures are being taken to improve the regulatory framework governing the activities of commercial banks and participants in the financial system.
"
10-5-1-1.data_sources: The National Bank of the Kyrgyz Republic based on the reports of commercial banks within the framework of the Periodic Regulatory Banking Report; Information from the National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic
10-5-1-1.data_collection: Commercial banks of the Kyrgyz Republic provide to the National Bank of the Kyrgyz Republic, within the framework of the Periodic Regulatory Banking Report, data on total assets on a daily basis, data on the deposit base and loan portfolio on a monthly basis.          The calculation of GDP is carried out by the National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic.
10-5-1-1.comments_limitations: Data on assets to GDP have been provided by the NBKR since 2008; on the deposit base to GDP and loan portfolio to GDP - since 2007.
10-5-1-1.quality_assurance: The information is provided by commercial banks in accordance with the Regulation on the Periodic Regulatory Banking Report, approved by Resolution No. 26/5 of the Board of the National Bank of the Kyrgyz Republic dated August 25, 2005.
10-5-1-1.data_availability_gaps: Data on the total assets of the banking system, the total deposit base and the loan portfolio of commercial banks are published on a monthly basis on the official website of the NBKR in the Statistics section and in the corresponding tables II.2. "Consolidated Regulatory Report of commercial Banks of the Kyrgyz Republic", IV.2.12 "Volumes and interest rates on deposits in commercial banks in national and foreign currencies (at the end of the period)", IV.2.21 "Volumes and interest rates of loans from commercial banks in national and foreign currencies (outstanding at the end of the period)" Bulletin of the NBKR. GDP data is published on a monthly basis on the official website of the NSC of the Kyrgyz Republic in the publication "Socio-economic Situation of the Kyrgyz Republic".
10-5-1-1.disaggregation: The data is provided at the country level, by year.                                        Non-existent data is indicated as "-".
10-5-1-1.international_comparability: The National Bank of the Kyrgyz Republic annually submits information on the total assets of the banking system, the deposit base and the loan portfolio of commercial banks to the IMF by completing a Questionnaire on the Availability of Financial Services (FAS).

1-b-1-1.indicator_name: Proportion of government recurrent and capital spending to sectors
1-b-1-1.graph_title: Proportion of government recurrent and capital spending to sectors
1-b-1-1.goal_name: 1. End poverty in all its forms everywhere
1-b-1-1.target_name: 1.b.1 Proportion of current and capital public expenditure in sectors that benefits women, the poor and vulnerable 32.
1-b-1-1.indicator_name1: 1.b.1.1 Current and capital government spending by sector
1-b-1-1.organization_name: Ministry of Finance of the Kyrgyz Republic (Budget Policy Department)
1-b-1-1.definitions: Current and capital public expenditures in the sectors (economy, healthcare, education and housing and utilities services) in proportion to total public expenditures in these sectors. Costs related to the State performance.
1-b-1-1.concepts:
Current expenditures ensure the regular functioning of State authorities in these sectors. 
Capital expenditure is the public monetary expenditure to finance investments and innovations.
1-b-1-1.data_sources: Data on public expenditures are data of the Central Treasury of the Ministry of Finance of the Kyrgyz Republic (hereinafter CT MF KR)
1-b-1-1.data_collection:
Data on public expenditures are data of the Central Treasury of the Ministry of Finance of the Kyrgyz Republic based on reports on implementation of the state, national and local budgets. 
Law on the national budget for releavnt years.
1-b-1-1.data_availability_gaps: Data on this indicator are available in the annual dynamics since 2013. Data are available at the MF KR website.
1-b-1-1.disaggregation: Data on this indicator are available nationawide in the Kyrgyz Republic and by four sectors.
1-b-1-1.international_comparability: Public expenditure in general and by type - according to the 2001 IMF Statistics Manual, including non-financial assets procurement.
1-b-1-1.references_documentation: The Kyrgyz Republic SDG National Reporting Platform: https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan.github.io

15-2-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
15-2-1.goal_name: 15. Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
15-2-1.target_name: 15.2 By 2020, promote the implementation of sustainable management of all types of forests, halt deforestation, restore degraded forests and substantially increase afforestation and reforestation globally
15-2-1.organization_name: SAEPF, Department of Forest Ecosystem Development, State Institution “
15-2-1.contact_name: Kyrgyz Forest Management" Zhumaev Nurlan Kadyrovich, Chukumbaev Sabyr Zholochievich"
15-2-1.definitions:
Reforestation in forests of national importance includes: planting and sowing forests; promoting natural regeneration of forests. 
Also, measures are being taken to create plantings on ravines, gullies, sands and other inconvenient lands, the cultivation and introduction of young trees into the category of valuable tree plantations in forests of national importance, the creation of nurseries of tree and shrub species, the planting of seedlings and cuttings of tree, shrub, fruit and berry and technical breeds in schools. 
Increase of forests due to reforestation measures. Changing the forest area will allow us to assess the preservation of natural forest ecosystems. The dynamic growth of the indicator shows an adequate policy in the field of forest conservation and enhancement.
15-2-1.data_sources: National forest inventory, accounting of the forest fund
15-2-1.data_collection:
"The SAEPF generates data on the area of reforestation in forests of national importance, including planting and sowing forests, and promoting natural regeneration. 
The SAEPF collects data based on reports from forestry enterprises, nature parks, and nature reserves by region and summarizes information at the republic level. 
The NSC collects information from forestry enterprises and other enterprises engaged in forestry work based on the state statistical reporting form "Forestry Work Report".
The data of the National Forest Inventory of the Kyrgyz Republic were approved by Resolution No. 407 of the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic dated July 26, 11. The second national forest inventory of the Kyrgyz Republic has been launched."
15-2-1.data_availability_gaps: The data is available to interested parties on the websites of specialized bodies and official statistics, as well as country reports on biodiversity.
15-2-1.references_documentation: The National SDG Reporting Platform of the Kyrgyz Republic: https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan .github.io

1-3-1-a.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
1-3-1-a.indicator_name: Proportion of population receiving monthly allowance for low-income families/"uy-bulogo komok", social benefits and pensions
1-3-1-a.graph_title: Proportion of population receiving monthly allowance for low-income families/"uy-bulogo komok", social benefits and pensions
1-3-1-a.goal_name: 1. End poverty in all its forms everywhere
1-3-1-a.target_name: 1.3: Implement nationally appropriate social protection systems and measures for all, including floors, and by 2030 achieve substantial coverage of the poor and the vulnerable
1-3-1-a.indicator_name1: 1.3.1.a Proportion of the population receiving MSB/"Üy-bülögö kömök" (family assistance) to the total population
1-3-1-a.organization_name: The National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Social Statistics Division)
1-3-1-a.definitions: Population covered by pensions or social allowances
1-3-1-a.concepts:
Pension (allowance) recipient is an individual covered by a pension (allowance). 
Pension is an insurance benefit payable in the insured event to the insured person in the amount and under the conditions provided for in the legislation on state pension social insurance.
The number of pension recipients is the number of persons as of the end (beginning) of the reporting year covered by monthly payment on the terms and conditions stipulated by the legislation on pension provision. The total number of pension recipients is calculated based on the number of personal pensioners’ accounts registered with the Social Fund, other ministries and departments, as well as the Non-State Pension Fund.
Mandatory social security is a system of social and economic measures enshrined in legislation to guarantee material security for citizens in old age, in the event of disability or loss of breadwinner in the family; and to provide benefits to families with relatively low average per capita incomes, if they are not entitled to a pension.
1-3-1-a.rationale_interpretation:
The Kyrgyz legislation provides for legal regulation of guaranteed minimum social standards to ensure the basic living needs of the population, including social standards for pensions.
Insured citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic, foreign citizens and stateless persons residing in the country who contribute to the state pension social insurance on the basis of and under the conditions stipulated in the Law of the Kyrgyz Republic on the State Social Insurance:627} have the right to pensions under the state pension social insurance (hereinafter - pensions).
1-3-1-a.data_sources: The Social Fund of the Kyrgyz Republic, the Ministry of Labour and Social Development of the Kyrgyz Republic, the Accumulative Pension Fund of the Kyrgyz Republic, ministries and departments with pension bodies submit administrative data according to the approved state statistical reporting forms.
1-3-1-a.data_collection: On an annual basis, the NSC collects and processes Report on the social benefits’ recipients and monthly allowances’ amount, Report on the number of pensioners and their monthly pensions, Report on the number of pensioners registered with the Accumulative Pension Fund and their monthly pensions, Report on the number of pensioners in security, defence and law enforcement agencies and their pension amount according to the statistical reporting forms.
1-3-1-a.computation_methods: The ratio of the number of pensioners registered in all pension bodies and the number of citizens covered by social benefits to the total population.
1-3-1-a.quality_assurance: Supervisory authorities monitor personal accounts and pensions and benefits amount.
1-3-1-a.international_comparability: Pension age is is established by the Kyrgyz Republic laws
1-3-1-a.references_documentation: Law of the Kyrgyz Republic on the State Pension Social Insurance:  http://cbd.minjust.gov.kg/act/view/ru-ru/557/310?cl=ru-ru

16-1-3-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
16-1-3-1.indicator_name: Proportion of women aged 15–49 subjected to physical violence (robbery or assault) in the last 12 months
16-1-3-1.graph_title: Proportion of women aged 15–49 subjected to physical violence (robbery or assault) in the last 12 months
16-1-3-1.goal_name: 16. Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
16-1-3-1.target_name: 16.1 Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
16-1-3-1.indicator_name1: 16.1.3.1 Proportion of women aged 15–49 subjected to physical violence (robbery or assault) in the last 12 months
16-1-3-1.organization_name: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Department of Household Statistics)
16-1-3-1.definitions: The percentage of women aged 15-49 who have been physically assaulted (including robbery or assault) in the last 12 months is the percentage of women in this age group who reported being victims of one or more acts of physical violence during the one year preceding the time of the survey.
16-1-3-1.concepts:
Physical violence is any use of physical force that causes or may cause harm to health. It includes hitting, pushing, strangulation, assault with a weapon, and other forms of violent physical impact.                                      Robbery is the violent or threatening seizure of property from a person, usually in a public place. This crime includes the threat or actual use of force.                                                                      Assault is an act of violent physical impact on a person, aimed at causing harm. 
________________________________________
16-1-3-1.rationale_interpretation: Crime can have a big impact on the lives of victims and the community in which they live. Victims of crimes can suffer physically and psychologically, as well as lose property and income. In addition, crime can cause significant damage to the community in the form of measures that the community may need to prevent and/or correct criminal acts.
16-1-3-1.data_sources: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic on the basis of Cluster Survey data on many indicators Kyrgyzstan
16-1-3-1.data_collection:
Computer-Assisted Personal Interview (CAPI) is used in COMP surveys. The data collection application, including the special COMP data management platform, is based on the CSPro (Census and Survey Processing System) software version 6.3. The procedures and standard programs developed under the COMP global program were adapted to the final version of the COMP Kyrgyzstan questionnaire, 2018 and used in the survey. 
The data was collected using tablet computers running the Windows 8 operating system using a Bluetooth application for field operations, which allowed assignments and completed questionnaires to be transferred from/to the tablets of the supervisor and interviewer.
16-1-3-1.computation_methods: The percentage of women aged 15-49 who have been physically assaulted (including robbed or assaulted) in the last 12 months .
16-1-3-1.quality_assurance:
The team leaders were responsible for the daily monitoring of field operations. A mandatory repeat survey was conducted in one household from the cluster. Daily observations of the interviewer's skills and results were carried out.
During the field work, each team was visited several times by the survey managers, and field visits were organized by members of the UNICEF team.
During the field work, verification tables were created every week for analysis and work with field teams, which were adapted versions of standard tables created by the COMP Program.
16-1-3-1.disaggregation: By territory, place of residence, income level, age, education level, and disability status.
16-1-3-1.international_comparability: The standardized UNICEF methodology ensures comparability of data between countries and regions. The methodology includes clear instructions on sampling, question formulation, and data collection and processing.

4-c-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
4-c-1.indicator_name: Proportion of teachers with the minimum required qualifications, by education level
4-c-1.graph_title: Proportion of teachers with the minimum required qualifications, by education level
4-c-1.goal_name: 4. Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
4-c-1.target_name: 4.c. By 2030, substantially increase the supply of qualified teachers, including through international cooperation for teacher training in developing countries, especially least developed countries and small island developing States
4-c-1.indicator_name1: 4.c.1 Proportion of teachers with the minimum required qualifications, by education level
4-c-1.organization_name: National Statistical Committee of KR (Social Statistics Division)
4-c-1.definitions: The percentage of teachers  who have received at least the minimum organized pedagogical teacher training pre-service and in-service required for teaching at the relevant level
4-c-1.concepts: A trained specialist is a qualification given to persons who have completed a full higher education programme in a relevant specialty.
4-c-1.rationale_interpretation: Teachers play a key role in ensuring the quality of education provided. Ideally all teachers should receive adequate, appropriate and relevant pedagogical training to teach at the chosen level of education and be academically well-qualified in the subject(s) they are expected to teach. This indicator measures the share of the teaching work force which is pedagogically well-trained.
4-c-1.data_sources: Data for calculating the indicator are obtained from the annual State statistical reports submitted by country’s pre-school organizations in the form «Report of pre-school organization», as well as general education organizations in the form ES-1 «Report of general education school at the beginning of the academic year».
4-c-1.data_collection:
Statistical observation method - complete observations based on annual statistical reporting
Statistical observation focuses on the number of teachers who have completed higher or specialized secondary pedagogical degree.
Units of observation are pre-school organizations, general educational organizations (schools)
4-c-1.computation_methods:
The number of teachers with higher and specialized secondary degree divided by the total number of teachers in a given academic year and multiplied by 100.
Following the formula:
y = n / N * 100 , where
y =percentage of certified teachers 
n = number of teachers with higher and secondary degrees
N =total number of teachers in a given academic year.
4-c-1.disaggregation: Indicators are disaggregated by area, type of location and type of ownership.
4-c-1.references_documentation:
https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan.github.io
www.uis.unesco.org 
Law of the Kyrgyz Republic №92 dated 30 April 2003  «On Education»

9-1-2.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
9-1-2.indicator_name: Passenger and freight volumes, by mode of transport
9-1-2.graph_title: Passenger and freight volumes, by mode of transport
9-1-2.goal_name: 9: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation
9-1-2.target_name: 9.1. Develop quality, reliable, sustainable and resilient infrastructure, including regional and transborder infrastructure, to support economic development and human well-being, with a focus on affordable and equitable access for all
9-1-2.indicator_name1: 9.1.2. Passenger and freight volumes, by mode of transport
9-1-2.organization_name: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Department of Trade and Services Statistics, Information and Communication Technologies, and Tourism)
9-1-2.definitions:
Passenger and freight volumes are measured by:  

Freight transported (volume of goods transported) - quantity of goods transported in tons. Passenger transport - number of passengers carried over a certain period of time is counted by transport and communications.
9-1-2.concepts:
The start of freight transport process is indicated by "dispatched goods", the end by "arrival of goods". For individual transport businesses, "transported goods" indicator is used to describe the total volume, which is defined as the sum of goods dispatched and accepted from other transport entities for transporting.
Passenger journey is the unit of observation in passenger transport statistics. Departure timing of passengers varies from one mode of transport to another, either from the moment of ticket purchase (road, rail) or at the moment of vehicle departure (water, air), departure and arrival(freight) of vehicle (air and rail transport).
Transport of the Kyrgyz Republic includes road, rail, air, inland waterway and urban electric transport registered in the territory of the Kyrgyz Republic, as well as trunk pipeline transport owned by the Kyrgyz Republic.  
Transport services include: - activities related to passenger or freight services (rail, road, pipeline, water, air) under and outside the schedule; - support activities such as terminal services, Transport handling, storage and other ancillary activities; Leasing of transport equipment with the driver (or specialized staff);
9-1-2.rationale_interpretation: The objective of transport statistics is to monitor facts and processes in transport (infrastructure size, mobile equipment, traffic volumes and other transport related indicators)as well as tasks in ensuring quality, objective and complete information received from enterprises and organizations; estimation of entrepreneurial activity (private persons) and compilation of consolidated data by statistical agencies according to unified methodology. Transport statistics do not limit to indicator, but also examine the reasons for deviations and availability of reserves.
9-1-2.data_sources: Data for indicator derived from the State statistical reports and results of sample surveys in road transport (freight and passenger) by private entrepreneurs (private persons)
9-1-2.data_collection: Statistical reporting forms (monthly, quarterly and annual) are submitted by legal entities providing transport services to regional NSC offices. Data on transport services by individual entrepreneurs and individuals are compiled on the basis quarterly sample surveys conducted by specialists of state statistical agencies.
9-1-2.computation_methods:
Total (Wtotal) services (freight transportation) of road freight transport include:
• total volume of goods transported by trucks, pickups and vans on passenger cars and motor trailers by specialized road transport enterprises (small, medium, large) (Vate);
• total volume of goods carried out by trucks of country’s enterprises and organizations with freight road transport as a form of auxiliary activity (Vaa);
• volume estimates (private persons) - truck owners doing business without legal entity (entrepreneur)  (Vpp)
or Wtotal.= Vate + Vaa+ Vpp 
Data on freight transported by specialized road transport enterprises are obtained from the monthly, quarterly and annual state statistical forms (Form №1-AUTO «Report on Urban and Road Transport», Form 6№5-AUTOM «Report on the Road Transport Production», Form №5-AX «Report on Road Transport Income and Expenditure»).
Similarly volumes of goods turnover carried out by specialized road transport enterprises is determined (Form №1-AUTO, Form №65-AUTOM, Form №5-AX).
Volume of freight transport (cargo turnover) at enterprises, organizations with road transport as a type of ancillary activity is estimated monthly (through quarterly sample survey); and annually according to the data of state statistical reports (Form №1-TP (SCO) «Report on Road Transport»).
Additional calculation of volumes of commercial transport by entrepreneurs (private persons) - owners of trucks is based on a quarterly sample survey. 
Total passenger transportation (Wpass.) by road includes:
• Passenger transportation by buses of specialized road transport enterprises (small, medium, large) Vate (buses);
• Transportation volumes by buses owned by citizens and buses rented to private persons Vpp (buses) and calculations of passenger car traffic of individual owners who have been allowed by the tax inspection authorities to provide services Vpp (taxi)
or Wpass. = Vate (buses) + Vpp (buses) + Vpp (taxi) 
Similar approach is used to calculate total passenger volumes.
Data on passengers transported by buses of specialized road transport enterprises are obtained based on monthly, quarterly, annual state statistical reports - (Form №1-AUTO, Form №65-AUTOM, Form №5-AX).
Same is used to calculate passengers transported by specialized motor transport enterprises.
Volume of passengers transported by buses, taxis and passengers transported by individual entrepreneurs (private persons) is estimated based on quarterly sample survey data.
9-1-2.comments_limitations:
Transport statistics focus on economic processes and phenomena occuring in transport enterprises and representing results of transport process and its implementation at a specific time and place.
A system of indicators allows determining the volume, structure, dynamics and relationships of factors and production outcomes. Thus, statistics make it possible to quantify the relationships and patterns in transport industry.
9-1-2.quality_assurance: Logical and arithmetic control of recorded data is carried out. All data are analyzed for consistency.
9-1-2.data_availability_gaps: Time series have been available since 1993. Data published in statistical bulletin «Basic Indicators of Trade and Services», compendium «Consumer Market of the Kyrgyz Republic» and on the NSC website
9-1-2.disaggregation: Disaggregation by territory: country, region, district, user categories.

16-1-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
16-1-1.indicator_name: Number of victims of intentional homicide per 100,000 population, by sex and age
16-1-1.graph_title: Число жертв умышленных убийств и умышленного причинения вреда здоровью, повлекшее по неосторожности смерть на 100 000 человек
16-1-1.goal_name: Goal 16: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
16-1-1.target_name: 16.1: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
16-1-1.indicator_name1: 16.1.1: Number of victims of intentional homicide per 100,000 population, by sex and age
16-1-1.organization_name: The National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Demographic Statistics Department)
16-1-1.definitions: The total count of victims of intentional homicide divided by the total population, expressed per 100,000 population.
16-1-1.concepts: Intentional homicide is defined as the unlawful death inflicted upon a person with the intent to cause death or serious injury (Source: International Classification of Crime for Statistical Purposes, ICCS 2015).
16-1-1.rationale_interpretation:
This indicator is widely used at national and international level to measure the most extreme form of violent crime and it also provides a direct indication of lack of security. Security from violence is a prerequisite for individuals to enjoy a safe and active life and for societies and economies to develop freely. Intentional homicides occur in all countries of the world and this indicator has a global applicability.
Monitoring intentional homicides is necessary to better assess their causes, drivers and consequences and, in the longer term, to develop effective preventive measures. If data are properly disaggregated (as suggested in the ICCS 2015), the indicator can identify the different type of violence associated with homicide: inter-personal (including partner and family-related violence), crime (including organized crime and other forms of criminal activities) and socio-political (including terrorism, hate crime).
16-1-1.data_sources: The source of information on death causes are based on medical records issued by a doctor or paramedic regarding illness, accident, homicide, suicide and other external influences that caused the death. These documents, alongside with the death records, are submitted to the State statistics authorities for further processing.
16-1-1.data_collection: Death data are obtained based on annual statistical compilation from the death records issued by civil registry offices. Aggregate data are collected and processed by the regional statistical offices and the National Statistical Committee (NSC) of the Kyrgyz Republic.
16-1-1.computation_methods: The proportion of the total number of victims of intentional homicide recorded in a given year divided by the total resident population in the same year. Calculated per 100,000 population.
16-1-1.comments_limitations:
The ICCS 2015 provides important clarifications on the definition of intentional homicide. In particular, it states that the following killings are included in the count of homicide:
- Murder
- Honour killing
- Serious assault leading to death
- Death as a result of terrorist activities
- Dowry-related killings
- Femicide
- Infanticide
- Voluntary manslaughter
- Extrajudicial killings
- Killings caused by excessive force by law enforcement/state officials. 
Furthermore, the ICCS provides indications on how to distinguish between intentional homicides, killings directly related to war/conflict and other killings that amount to war crimes.
16-1-1.quality_assurance: Logical and arithmetic control of the reported data is performed. Death data verification in death records is carried out through logical control, embedded in the data input and development software. Death codes provided in the death records based on the diagnoses are brought in line with ICD-10. Analysis of output tables by death causes.
16-1-1.data_availability_gaps: Data on suicide deaths are published in statistical compendiums “Women and Men in the KR”, “Social trends in the KR”, “Statistical yearbook of the KR”, “Kyrgyzstan in figures”, and are placed at the NSC website.
16-1-1.disaggregation:
By area – country, oblast, district
By sex – both genders – mena and women.
16-1-1.international_comparability: The national indicator definition used in statistics corresponds to its international definition. Death data are coded and processed according to death causes by the state statistical bodies in line with the International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Causes of Death, 10th revision (ICD-10) of the World Health Organization (WHO) since submission of 2000 Report. As agreed with the NSC, the mortality database is transferred to the eHealth Centre of the Kyrgyz Republic under the Ministry of Health: Form 2 Information on the Number of Births, Marriages, Divorces and Deaths by death causes monthly, with a 1.5 month delay of the reporting month; and Form C52 Mortality by Death Causes annually, in June in the year following the reporting year.
16-1-1.references_documentation:
The Kyrgyz Republic SDG National Reporting Platform: https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan.github.io 
Links to normative legal acts and methodology: http://www.stat.kg/u/about/pravovye-osnovy-organov-gosudarstvennoj-statistiki/; https://unstats.un.org/sdgs/Metadata; http://www.stat.kg/ru/statistics/download/methodology/68/. The NSC statistical publications: Socio-Economic Status of the Kyrgyz Republic – monthly report; statistical compendiums: Women and Men in the Kyrgyz Republic, Social trends in the Kyrgyz Republic, Public Health and Health Care in the Kyrgyz Republic available at the official NSC KR website: http://www.stat.kg/ru/publications/

5-3-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
5-3-1.indicator_name: Proportion of women aged 20–24 years who were married or in a union before age 15 and before age 18
5-3-1.graph_title: Proportion of women aged 20–24 years who were married or in a union before age 15 and before age 18
5-3-1.goal_name: 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
5-3-1.target_name: 5.3. Eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation
5-3-1.indicator_name1: 5.3.1. Proportion of women aged 20-24 years who were married or in a union before age 15 and before age 18
5-3-1.organization_name: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Department of Household Statistics)
5-3-1.definitions: Proportion of women aged 20-24 years who were married or in a union before age 15 and before age 18
5-3-1.concepts: Both formal (i.e., marriages) and informal unions are covered under this indicator. Informal unions are generally defined as those in which a couple lives together for some time, intends to have a lasting relationship, but for which there has been no formal civil or religious ceremony (i.e., cohabitation).
5-3-1.rationale_interpretation: Marriage before the age of 18 is a fundamental violation of human rights. Child marriage often compromises a girl’s development by resulting in early pregnancy and social isolation, interrupting her schooling, limiting her opportunities for career and vocational advancement and placing her at increased risk of intimate partner violence. In many cultures, girls reaching puberty are expected to assume gender roles associated with womanhood. These include entering a union and becoming a mother. The practice of early/child marriage is a direct manifestation of gender inequality. The issue of child marriage is addressed in a number of international conventions and agreements. Although marriage is not mentioned directly in the Convention on the Rights of the Child, child marriage is linked to other rights – such as the right to freedom of expression, the right to protection from all forms of abuse, and the right to be protected from harmful traditional practices.
5-3-1.data_collection: ComputerAssisted Personal Interview (CAPI) have been used for surveys. The application for data collection, including a special CAPI data management platform, is based on CSPro (Census and Survey Processing System) version 6.3. Procedures and standard software developed under the global CAPI programme were adapted to the final version of the 2018 CAPI questionnaire for Kyrgyzstan and used in the survey.
5-3-1.computation_methods: Number of women aged 20-24 who were first married or in union before age 15 (or before age 18) divided by the total number of women aged 20-24 in the population multiplied by 100
5-3-1.comments_limitations: UNICEF Country Offices are invited to submit, through an online system, any updated data for a number of key indicators on the well-being of women and children. Updates sent by the country offices are then reviewed by sector specialists at UNICEF headquarters to check for consistency and overall data quality of the submitted estimates. This review is based on a set of objective criteria to ensure that only the most recent and reliable information is included in the databases. Once reviewed, feedback is made available on whether or not specific data points are accepted, and if not, the reasons why.
5-3-1.quality_assurance: There are existing tools and mechanisms for data collection that countries have implemented to monitor the situation with regards to this indicator. The modules used to collect information on marital status among women and men of reproductive age (15-49 years) in the DHS and MICS have been fully harmonized.
5-3-1.data_availability_gaps: Comparable data on this indicator are currently available for 124 low- and middle-income countries
5-3-1.disaggregation: Age, place of residence, geographic location, education and other background characteristics of women
5-3-1.international_comparability: Global aggregates are weighted averages of all the sub-regions that make up the world. Regional aggregates are weighted averages of all the countries within the region. Comparable data on this indicator are currently available for 124 low- and middle-income countries

16-1-1-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
16-1-1-1.goal_name: 16. Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
16-1-1-1.target_name: 16.1 Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
16-1-1-1.organization_name: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Demographic Statistics Department)
16-1-1-1.definitions: The death rate associated with fatal attacks.
16-1-1-1.concepts:
Population mortality is the process of generation extinction, one of the two main subprocesses of population reproduction. Causes of death are diseases, pathological conditions, or injuries that led to or contributed to death, as well as the circumstances of an accident or act of violence that caused a fatal injury. Causes of death have been coded since 2000 based on the International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Causes of Death, 10th Revision (ICD-10) The World Health Organization.  
 Premeditated murder is an unlawful death inflicted on a person with the intention of causing death or serious injury. (Source: International Classification of Crimes for Statistical Purposes, ICCS 2015).
16-1-1-1.rationale_interpretation:
This indicator is widely used at the national and international levels to assess the most extreme forms of violent crimes, and also shows the obvious weaknesses of the security system of citizens. Ensuring safety from violence is a prerequisite for people to live a safe and active life, and it is also necessary for the free development of society and the economy. Premeditated murders occur in all countries of the world, this indicator has a global scale. 
It is necessary to monitor premeditated murders in order to better understand their causes, intentions and consequences and, in the long term, develop effective preventive measures. If the data is correctly detailed (according to the International Classification of Crimes for Statistical Purposes, ICCS 2015), the indicator can identify various types of homicide-related violence: interpersonal (including partner violence, family violence), criminal (including organized crime and other forms of criminal activity), socio-political (including terrorism and hate crimes).
16-1-1-1.data_sources: The source of information about the causes of death is the entries in medical death certificates drawn up by a doctor or nursing staff regarding illness, accident, murder, suicide and other external influences that caused death. These documents, together with the death certificates, are sent to the state statistical authorities for development.
16-1-1-1.data_collection: Information on deaths is obtained on the basis of the annual statistical development of data contained in death records compiled by the civil registry offices (Registry Office at the State Registration Service under the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic). Aggregated data is collected and processed by the regional statistical offices and the NSC of the Kyrgyz Republic.
16-1-1-1.computation_methods: The ratio of deaths from fatal attacks to the average annual permanent population according to current estimates. Calculated per 100,000 population.
16-1-1-1.comments_limitations: Know the rules for encoding the initial cause of death and definitions set out in the classifier International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems 10th Revision (ICD-10). In case of difficulty with the correctness of the diagnosis, contact the staff of the E-Health Center of the Ministry of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic in order to establish a definitive diagnosis.
16-1-1-1.quality_assurance: Logical and arithmetic control of the reporting data is carried out. The procedure for verifying the correctness of data in death records is carried out through logical control embedded in the data entry and development software. The cause of death codes are adjusted to match the diagnoses recorded in the death certificate according to ICD-10, and the output tables for causes of death are analyzed.
16-1-1-1.data_availability_gaps: Data on deaths from attacks are published in the statistical collections "Women and Men of the Kyrgyz Republic", "Crime and Law and Order in the Kyrgyz Republic", posted on the NSC website.
16-1-1-1.disaggregation: By territory (republic, region, district), and by gender
16-1-1-1.international_comparability: The national definition of the indicator used in statistics corresponds to its international definition. The coding and development of data on deaths due to causes of death are carried out by state statistical authorities on the basis of the International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Causes of Death, 10th revision (ICD-10) The World Health Organization (WHO), since the 2000 report. By agreement with the NSC, the mortality database is transferred to the Center for Electronic Health of the Kyrgyz Republic under the Ministry of Health: form 2 "Information on the number of births, marriages, divorces and deaths due to causes of death" – monthly, with a lag of 1.5 months. from the reporting month and form C52 "Mortality due to causes of death" – annually, in June of the year following the reporting year.
16-1-1-1.references_documentation:
"Links to the NPA and methodology: http://www.stat.kg/ru/about/pravovye-osnovy-organov-gosudarstvennoj-statistiki / https://unstats.un.org/sdgs/metadata/files/Metadata http://www.stat.kg/ru/statistics/download/methodology/68 / NSC statistical publications: monthly report "Socio-economic situation of the Kyrgyz Republic", statistical collections: "Social trends of the Kyrgyz Republic", "Women and Men of the Kyrgyz Republic", "Public health and healthcare in the Kyrgyz Republic" on the official website of the NSC of the Kyrgyz Republic: http://www.stat.kg/ru/publications /
National Platform SDG reporting of the Kyrgyz Republic: 
https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan.github.io"

3-a-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
3-a-1.indicator_name: Age-standardized prevalence of current tobacco use among persons aged 15 years and older
3-a-1.graph_title: Age-standardized prevalence of current tobacco use among persons aged 15 years and older
3-a-1.goal_name: 3 Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-a-1.target_name: 3.a Strengthen the implementation of the World Health Organization Framework Convention on Tobacco Control in all countries, as appropriate
3-a-1.indicator_name1: 3.a.1 Age-standardized prevalence of current tobacco use among persons aged 15 years and older
3-a-1.organization_name: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Department of Household Statistics)
3-a-1.definitions: The proportion of tobacco users aged 15 and over, by gender, is determined by the ratio of the number of tobacco users to the population included in the coverage by gender.
3-a-1.concepts:
Tobacco use is one of the main preventable causes
of premature death and disease worldwide. Tobacco smoking is a serious medical, social and economic problem all over the world. According to WHO, tobacco use annually claims the lives of almost 6 million people, of which more than 5 million are tobacco users and former users, and more than 600 thousand are non—smokers exposed to second—hand smoke.
3-a-1.rationale_interpretation: Monitoring the prevalence and characteristics of tobacco use is the first of six measures established by WHO to combat the tobacco epidemic and the first step in creating a system for monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of anti—smoking policy implementation. Monitoring data is necessary for the implementation and evaluation of public policy measures to combat tobacco use, to provide policy makers with up-to-date information on the scale of the tobacco epidemic, its features and measures aimed at overcoming it, taking into account the needs of various segments of the population, and to implement an effective anti-smoking policy in the country. An analysis of the prevalence of tobacco use is necessary to track trends related to this problem in society, the effectiveness of various legislative initiatives, and identify areas for effective law enforcement.
3-a-1.data_sources: The calculation of indicator 3.a.1. "Prevalence of tobacco use by persons aged 15 and over" was based on data from an integrated sample survey of household budgets and the labor force. The indicator has been upgraded to the category of national indicators due to the fact that age standardization is carried out by the World Health Organization based on the sex and age of the population of the countries of the region.
3-a-1.data_collection: Data on this indicator is collected through national household surveys. ITU collects data on this indicator through an annual questionnaire, which it sends to the heads of national statistical organizations (NSOs).
3-a-1.computation_methods: The indicator is calculated by dividing the total number of individuals who use tobacco at the age of 15 by the total number of people included in the scope.
3-a-1.comments_limitations: The methodology uses data provided by the national authorities of the administrative systems of the countries, as well as data on immunization or data from many indicators from household surveys (MICS).
3-a-1.data_availability_gaps: The indicator is disaggregated by gender, regions (geographical and urban/rural), age groups, and education level.
3-a-1.international_comparability: There are no sources of discrepancies. ITU uses data provided by countries, including population coverage, which is used to calculate percentages. The data is usually not adjusted, but discrepancies in the definition, age scale of individuals, control period, or gap in comparability between years are noted in the data note. For this reason, the data is not always strictly comparable.

7-3-1-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
7-3-1-1.measurement_units: Tons of conventional fuel per 1 million soms
7-3-1-1.goal_name: 7: Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all
7-3-1-1.target_name: 7.3 By 2030, double the global rate of improvement in energy efficiency
7-3-1-1.organization_name: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Department of Economic Statistics and National Accounts)
7-3-1-1.definitions: The energy intensity of GDP is an indicator of the efficiency of energy consumption in a country. The energy intensity index indicates the overall relationship between energy consumption and economic development and provides a basis for estimating energy consumption.
7-3-1-1.concepts: Gross domestic product (GDP) is the most important indicator of national accounts, characterizing the state and development of the economy and economic growth trends of the Kyrgyz Republic over a certain period.  It reflects the value of goods and services produced in a country and intended for final consumption, accumulation and export.           Tons of conventional fuel (t.o.t.) - 1 ton (thousand cubic meters, thousand kW.hour, Gcal) multiplied by the conversion factor into tons of conventional fuel, is equal to 1 ton of conventional fuel.
7-3-1-1.rationale_interpretation: The energy intensity index indicates the overall relationship between energy consumption and economic development and provides a basis for estimating energy consumption. The rate of decrease in the energy intensity of GDP indicates the effectiveness of the state's energy-saving policy. Indicators of the energy intensity of GDP in individual sectors characterize indicators of the sustainable development of the sector and the general relationship between energy consumption and the economic development of this sector of the economy.
7-3-1-1.data_sources: Data collection, processing and calculation are carried out by the National Statistical Committee.
7-3-1-1.data_collection: The indicator is calculated, which uses data from industry statistics. Frequency: annual.
7-3-1-1.computation_methods: The energy intensity of GDP is the ratio of consumption of fuel and energy resources (fuel and energy complex) (coal, natural gas, metallurgical coke, heating oil, diesel fuel, gasoline, aviation kerosene, liquefied natural gas, electricity) in tons of conventional fuel to GDP (million soms, current and comparable prices).
7-3-1-1.comments_limitations: Energy intensity is just an imperfect proxy indicator of energy efficiency. It can be influenced by a number of factors such as climate, economic structure, the nature of economic activity, etc., which are not necessarily related to pure efficiency.
7-3-1-1.quality_assurance: Logical and arithmetic control of the reporting data is carried out.
7-3-1-1.data_availability_gaps: Dynamic series have been available since 2007. The data is published in various publications of the National Statistical Committee, posted on the website.NSC.
7-3-1-1.international_comparability: In world practice, the metric ton of oil equivalent (so-called oil equivalent)
7-3-1-1.references_documentation: National SDG Reporting Platform is used in energy intensity calculations.: https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan.github.io

9-2-1.goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
9-2-1.indicator_name: Manufacturing value added as a proportion of GDP and per capita
9-2-1.graph_title: Доля валовой добавленной стоимости продукции обрабатывающей промышленности в ВВП и в пересчете на душу населения
9-2-1.goal_name: 9. Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation
9-2-1.target_name: 9.2. Promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and, by 2030, significantly raise industry's share of employment and gross domestic product, in line with national circumstances, and double its share in least developed countries
9-2-1.indicator_name1: 9.2.1 Manufacturing value added as a proportion of GDP and per capita
9-2-1.organization_name:
National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic
